intro: Cheilanthes nitidula subsp. henryi, commonly known as the Henry's rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen rhizome and its ability to thrive in rocky, arid environments. The fronds are typically leathery and have a distinctive, glossy appearance. This subspecies is often found in limestone and granite substrates, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it a notable plant in arid and semi-arid regions.
